page.title: 12The Village Windmills
page.content: In Faldingworth there were two windmills. There was the postmill which doesn't stand any more and the cap mill which still stands in ruins. The post mill was wooden and was about 16m.high. The span of the sails was about 24m. long. It used to be in a lane near Orchard Farm. It was near a stream but it was used for grinding corn. It blew down in a gale just after the first world war and was never rebuilt. The cap mill is a brick mill and some grinding stones still remain as decorations in the farm yard opposite the mill. One of the villagers remembered that when he was a boy he used to grab a sail as it came round and hang on then let go as swept him up in the air.
